root.title: “Ih bichigt” inscription, The
root.place: The inscription is written on a rock of district “Ikh bichigt, Baga bichigt”, the 2nd bak (branch) of Gov-Ugtaal sum of Dundgovi aimag of Mongolia. There are Mongolian, Tibetan and many other symbols except Old Turkic and Uighur inscriptions on the rock.
root.general: The old Turkic inscription is written on 180 cm high from the ground. There are two old Uighur words below.
root.description: The old Turkic inscription consist of 16 symbols.
root.size: The length of the inscription is 61 cm. Size of a symbol is 8 cm.
root.investigation: T.Battulga 441 published the first report and made pictures, paper copies and translations.
